website_summaries.verdict: The best budget anchor buoy you can buy that will survive harsh abuse in the sea or large marine ports.
pros: Smaller size is perfect for light marine craft use in busy harbors and docks
Buoy easily deflates to keep stored on a boat when not in use
Inflates quickly with a simple pump
cons: Bright colors of the buoy can start to bleach out after a few weeks of use

customer_reviews.title: Best heavy bag
customer_reviews.text: Used as a punching bag when you fill it with water Makes a great alternative to the way overpriced aqua bag is just as good for less than half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: Affordable aqua bag
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a punching bag I fill it up with water you're gonna need a water jet nozzle which you can pick up at your local hardware store or Walmart. Haven't had any wear and tears so far from me hitting it. My only complain about this product it has a very strong chemical smell to it .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this A-3 Polyform buoy for way less than half the price of the overpriced aqua bags which will run you $199 for this size buoy. I have included all materials that I bought to install it as well. 1) Polyform A-3 buoy. 2) Eastern Jungle Gym Heavy Duty Tire Swivel. 3) Meister Professional Bag Spring 250lbs. 4) Twinkle Star Brass Jet Sweeper to fill water in the buoy. 5) 3/8 x 3in lag bolts to screw in the beams (2). 6) 3/8 clip links (2). 7) 3/8 quick links (2). 8) 2 ft 5/16 in chain. 9) Husky 3/4 in anchor shackle.
customer_reviews.author: Sayra Kohen International Executive Recruiter

customer_reviews.title: Punching bag verified
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Used a regular compression fitting to go from a garden hose to a 1/4" plastic tube. Drilled air filling hole out to 1/4" and works perfect. Filled 3/4 the way with water then a few burst of air and the plug with hold it air tight. Air gives it a nice pop. Not as heavy as some reviews say but it is very heavy, 150lbs maybe
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great water training bag for boxing!
customer_reviews.text: After seeing people use this as a water training bag for boxing i decided to give one a try. I used one of the small water hose water balloon fittings to fill the bag of hot water to help work on creases. I haven’t filled the bag more then 3/4 full an it’s working wonderful. I will fill it up more in time Then give a updated review. If you want to set up a cheap water bag for training get one of these and rig it up. This is so much cheaper then buying name brand and does the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin E.

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for a punching bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought A-3 to use as a heavy bag and I absolutely love it. The key is to find a nozzle/tip that can fit into the air valve, otherwise you will not be able fill the buoy with water. I am 6'3'', about 260 pounds, and have been boxing for about 8 months. I can unload on this bag and it takes it like a champ. Do not fill it so it is rock solid (unless you are some absolute machine of a boxer) otherwise you will get pretty sore.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: I RECOMEND THIS TO ANYONE LOOKING FOR AN AQUA PUNCHING BAG!
customer_reviews.text: VERY WELL PLEASED .. 100 STARS FOR THIS PRODUCT. I was able to save $30-50. This is exactly the same product that they use in boxing. The only difference is that the boxing one is well over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Donjohnson_opolentisima

customer_reviews.title: Get a buddy to help you hang it.
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to set up. You will need a hose with a an adapter to fill it up. You might want to get a buddy to help you since it is a bit cumbersome to hang. Great for home use. The directions to hang it can be found on YouTube on csquaredboxing page.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Andres

customer_reviews.title: High Strength and Quality Construction
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Extremely durable body - Easy to clean - Low weight and high buoyancy Cons: - Internal inflator valve not quite as robust as the body’s construction may lead you to believe - Does not come with necessary inflator adapter
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: Our Newest Dog Toy
customer_reviews.text: Not Being Used as Intended: We tired of various dog toys surrendering to the jaws of our Lab Shep mix within SECONDS. Her overactive jaws and non-stop play lead us to become inventive. She totes this Bouy everywhere. Tied a rope to it and we throw it for her. We kick it and use it to play tug. So far, so good. It continues to hold up
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - color faded then turned black.
customer_reviews.text: We used this for one summer on a fresh water lake. The color on the area of the buoy that was in the water bleached out. The lake is not treated with any chemicals or chlorine. I was very disappointed that this occurred after just one summer. After the second season the buoy turned black - almost appears as if it was dipped in black paint. Only a bit of the orange is visible. I don't understand it. We use this in a fresh water lake. No other buoys or bumpers turned black so it isn't something that was in the water. Nothing on any other boats or buoys. Just the strangest thing. We cannot use it.
customer_reviews.author: Piazzashell

customer_reviews.title: I got the smallest version and it works great as a boxing 'slip bag'
customer_reviews.text: It works great as a boxing 'slip bag'. Fills up easy too, its sturdy, seems like it'll last for years. Not big enough to be used as a traditional 'go all out' heavy bag because its the size of a small head, but as a hit once and slip/dodge/duck bag its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality materials. Quick to inflate (kind of an off inflation port, but easy to get around)
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Good quality materials. The inflation valve is not a shape I was familiar with: basically a small plastic plug that I unscrewed. Good news is I could blow it to full size, and it holds it shape even at 0 psi pressure, so once you have it blown to full size, just tighten the plug back on with a flat head screwdriver and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Lenoir

customer_reviews.title: This is what you need for an anchor ball
customer_reviews.text: Using this as an anchor retrieving ball and it does the job. I don’t know why I’ve ever pulled the anchor without this thing. Quite frankly, it’s about the same amount of work as using a windlass, and without the headache of knots and tangles that often happens with a windlass.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great punching bag
customer_reviews.text: A must have for anyone who wants a cheap punching bag. I created a little gym under my deck to help keep myself fit during this pandemic and I am loving it. This bag is very durable and can take a beating. The best part is when I am done using it I can just let the water out and store it away.
customer_reviews.author: GuyFromFrisco

customer_reviews.title: Had this bag for a number of years
customer_reviews.text: I completed a video of it on youtube under Weight Bully, sent some hard shots its way and it ate them no problem at all, I used for a punching bag, check it out, have had this bag for a number of years no issues at this time.
customer_reviews.author: killshock

customer_reviews.title: Boxing your corona away
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a boxing bag and came across these boat buoys. This one filled to about 58lbs and is pretty easy to get up and down on the hanger. It can take a beating too, very very sturdy and much quieter than a regular bag. You’ll need to get an attachment nozzle to fill it with water, a water balloon hose attachment is what I used. Then if you want to hang it would suggest getting a 3/4 bow shackle, any smaller sizes won’t be able to fit over the thick handle. Then get yourself a hanging rig. I went with a simple and cheap but sturdy boxing strap and S hook that I found on amazon. Happy boxing!
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck! Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Filled it up with water and using it as a punching bag, way cheaper then those expensive brand name boxing Aqua bags
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I installed these on the dock to keep my boat off the pilings and after two weeks they are incredibly durable and keep the boat for rubbing the rails. I purchased two and they are working great when the day-boaters go by at maximum speed.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey R.

customer_reviews.title: Big buoys for big boats!
customer_reviews.text: Used two A-3 size to keep my 10x30' houseboat from bashing our fixed pier. Easy to inflate with my compressor. Large surface area on impact seems to be much gentler on the boat's siding, not leaving any scuffs. So far they are working great and I see no reason why they won't last for many years to come. Edit: These are still good years later. Adding 2 more for more cushioning in our rough waters.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: How should I fill it?
customer_reviews.text: Hey, how i suppose to fill it? Little hole, no instructions... you guys could put special plug for hose... not happy
customer_reviews.author: Vladlen

customer_reviews.title: High quality buoy! Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Great Buoy! I bought this to attach to a mooring anchor so I could quickly find the spot to anchor my "water toys" I was very impressed with the quality of materials and the inflation system was easy to figure out. This thing should last MANY years exposed to the elements. If I ever need to replace it, I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Soucy

customer_reviews.title: Handle beatings well.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this as a water bag for training FMA. I have beaten the crap out of it and it has withstood the daily thrashing without even marring the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Seamus "Fack" O'Malley

customer_reviews.title: Great marker buoy
customer_reviews.text: This is the first yellow buoy that I have purchased. All other have been orange, and have faded in short time. At the very least, it helps me identify my lakefront, in a long line of orange ones! It is a good size, and easy to inflate. I especially like the screw in plug, very secure.
customer_reviews.author: jaybird

customer_reviews.title: Very thick and durable
customer_reviews.text: These are very heavy duty and very thick. I’m going to use mine for crab traps. The tops where the eyelet is are very strong and beefy. The Saturn yellow will be very easy to see in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Hole small but worked for our purposes
customer_reviews.text: The hole at top is kind of small. We used steel wire vs rope so worked great for us. If we had tried to a wide, sturdy rope through twice, it would not have fit.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: The Better Aqua Bag Purchase...
customer_reviews.text: Great for use as a heavy bag. Just know that the shell can harden up in cooler temps and the fuller it is. Definetly WRAP AND GLOVE up... Otherwise, no complaints really. It's a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs
customer_reviews.text: We are in a cove off of a lake and needed a buoy to mark our lines to attach a lily pad and float offof our dock. Works great - seems very durable.
customer_reviews.author: the girls

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Holds its color well after being in the ocean a year. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Maui Rater

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Fast Shipping
customer_reviews.text: Pretty straight forward as this is the top of the line manufacturer. I ordered over the weekend, and the boys were here early afternoon by USPS. There's no need to buy the adaptor (sold separately), if you have an inflator kit for an air compressor; you can use the rubber cone attachment to inflate.
customer_reviews.author: Apfels

customer_reviews.title: A boat saver!
customer_reviews.text: While traversing the Erie Canal we made the change from standard cylindrical fenders to these commercial-style Polyform buoy fenders. What a difference. Helps keep your boat away from the rough walls and holes, especially if you're [ahem] in a lock with one valve on a really windy day... trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very well built but 20 inch diameter is pretty huge!
customer_reviews.text: Great fender. I’ve had them before but in a smaller size. I have a 42 foot catamaran and these are probably larger than I really needed. But the will sure offer plenty of protection. Just hard to stow away. I hang them off of a rear rail.
customer_reviews.author: cwd777

customer_reviews.title: Great punching bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great punching bag. Similar to the aqua bag. Hang it then fill it with water using a hose and small water nosle. Affordable serious bag.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Diehl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great bag.. a lot harder than hitting a regular bag.. YouTube how to install before trying lol you need a hose extension.. I didn’t have one and I had to drench myself to fill it up haha
customer_reviews.author: anthony marker

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a water punching bag save your money and buy this!! Its easy to fill with water and way tougher!!
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: 1 of 2 defective
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased two of these. First one was good but lost off of boat. Tried to inflate second one for the first time and discovered pinholes in the seam. Think I’ll buy from West Marine from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: A-1 Bouy
customer_reviews.text: Great product, bright red color is very visible, quick delivery was nice and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Jon R. Bachman

customer_reviews.title: if you are using as a punching bag
customer_reviews.text: You need a nosel for your hose and when u want to fill it is when u have it hanging but it will be messy you will probably get wet because its not meant for it and the nosel i got wouldnt stay so i had to hold it in place but its an amazing bag people say it weighs like 120lbs but it seems like more the thing is heavy Hope this helped!
customer_reviews.author: LuckyHat1/Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Very well made!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty. Using it as an anchor bouy to help pull anchor and float it to the top. Total game changer. Love it and wish I got it much sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: make sure you have a nozzle
customer_reviews.text: was a little hard to keep filling past the line but works good as a punching bag
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Durable. Easy to inflate with my air compressor but use air sparingly as it only needs 2 Psi. I ordered the 11”x15”size which is a bit small for 22’ Tritoon next to dock , so am returning and get next bigger size. Excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Fredhogbristle

customer_reviews.title: Aqua heavy bag
customer_reviews.text: Fill with water using any regular hose sprayer (no need for attachment, just aim steady). Aqua heavy bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo R.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for use to mark off a swimming area off our dock at the river, and the price is much more reasonable than most other similar products.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Lukasik

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good price.
customer_reviews.text: Great fender at a good price. Much better deal than available at WestMarine. I didn't bother with the inflator adapter and had no problem inflating it with my manual bicycle pump. Used a small grommet to seal between fender and pump nozzle and it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Everett Harper

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: This is my third year using it as a buoy and it has help up well, even to the harsh winters in Upstate New York. I haven't had to refill the air in it since I first filled it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Roy

customer_reviews.title: For now sitting in the bottom of my boat useless. Excellent opportunity for quality check improvement
customer_reviews.text: Arrived missing the plug! For now sitting in the bottom of my boat useless. Excellent opportunity for quality check improvement. I will return it if I can’t find replacement plug that fits without leaking. Will come back to revise my rating if I can figure out a fix
customer_reviews.author: Nez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to blow up
customer_reviews.text: I think this will be perfect. It was easy to blow up with a basketball air needle and air pump. I'm taking it on water tomorrow to test it so I might be writing an update.
customer_reviews.author: Harold G. Branch

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to obtain full inflation
customer_reviews.text: Overall great, with the exception of inflation - air escapes when valve is pulled out making it difficult to get optimum inflation~
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Ducey

customer_reviews.title: Great product, keeps my boat off a tough docks.👍
customer_reviews.text: These work great, don't overfill with air so it can do its job, to firm and will dent an aluminum boat if you do. Buying 2 more asap..Thank you and stamped made in USA. I bought 2 of the max 20' boat white and blue one,
customer_reviews.author: JohnSnow

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love my polyform fenders! Replaced one that was stolen while at a municipal dock
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Team

customer_reviews.title: Provides superior protection to boat
customer_reviews.text: It is a perfect fit to protect the boat no matter what the water level or wind conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Rob H.

customer_reviews.title: Punching bag
customer_reviews.text: Using it for a water punching bag So far so good way cheaper than going with the name brand aqua punching bags
customer_reviews.author: Alex s.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a water filled punching bag/ kettle bell
customer_reviews.text: I use this like an aqua punching bag and it’s great. It was only tough to fill because I was filling with water and there’s a one way valve to keep air in which you need to puncture without ruining the threads to put cap back in. Also will probably get wet. It took about 5 minutes to fill but worth it when finished.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. Using for anchor retrieval. Heavy material. Should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Southern  Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Love’em
customer_reviews.text: High quality perfect size to put around my dock to keep boaters out.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Bad advertising for kids use
customer_reviews.text: Is not to be use for kids swing. It hurts there private parts and hard to swing. This should only be use for boats
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Marchoud

customer_reviews.title: Keeps boat away from dock
customer_reviews.text: Multi- use, keeps boat away from dock and dead fish kn harooon dart
customer_reviews.author: Fullabull

customer_reviews.title: True heavy duty marine grade product
customer_reviews.text: This float is very rugged. I use it as a scuba marker ball and clip it to a ring to lift my anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Big and Bright
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed to replace the first one we had on a play structure for 8 hrs in all kinds of New England weather. The kids love it!
customer_reviews.author: Blue House

customer_reviews.title: thank you
customer_reviews.text: one of the best, make sure to get special hose nozzle for this and GET A CHAIN
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: This buoy is great for boxing !! Definitely buy it. Don’t hesitate !
customer_reviews.author: Steeley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The buoys are just what I was looking for and the color is very vibrant
customer_reviews.author: fr texas

customer_reviews.title: Everything I hoped for!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about these, they are tough and easy to see.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Kilmer

customer_reviews.title: Great buoy.
customer_reviews.text: Great buoy...no instructions included on how to inflate it, however. I spent a week looking for a needle valve inflator, only to find out it has a simple "check ball valve," and any air pump will pump it up! Good quality plastic/rubber--should last for years.
customer_reviews.author: BusstopWillyg

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product in a good price I totally love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nmontre

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking mooring buoy.
customer_reviews.text: Using it as a buoy to mark anchor location and as a way to retrieve the anchor if snagged. The anchor line is attached to the rear of the anchor so that it will pull it up from the rear if snagged.
customer_reviews.author: FormosaTiger

customer_reviews.title: top quality
customer_reviews.text: bought with black skirt, top quality would recommend to buy to anyone
customer_reviews.author: captain

customer_reviews.title: Nice bumpers
customer_reviews.text: They come deflated, but easy to fill up. Work nicely as bumpers on my dock.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Summers

customer_reviews.title: Damage upon arrival.
customer_reviews.text: This was the second one I purchased. I was very disappointed when I noticed the cuts. Now I have to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for docking a boat up against a jagged pier without destroying the fiberglass.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Recommend as an Aqua punching bag
customer_reviews.text: Great product, using as a agua punching bag. Half the price.. felt like Mike Tyson rocking this bag. Used18 oz,16 oz,, multiple mma gloves, was great. Blessed 😇.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good product, but does not come with the inflation adapter, which is only a cheap piece of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Ezekiel

customer_reviews.title: The buoy works great, I installed 3 our gas dock to protect ...
customer_reviews.text: The buoy works great, I installed 3 our gas dock to protect against damage to boats hitting the dock. Mission was accomplished.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L DiClementi

customer_reviews.title: Good tough buoy
customer_reviews.text: Its a very sturdy buoy. We use it for dog water work and it holds up better than what we've tried before. I'd give it 5 stars except the fill method is somewhat awkward.
customer_reviews.author: John Parks

customer_reviews.title: Good punching bag
customer_reviews.text: As most people I bought this bouy as a water punching bag, it serves its purpose and will fill with water with some difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: isaac searfoss

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very substantial and great quality. Larger than expected but it works perfect for where we needed it.
customer_reviews.author: blake

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought two on for a lake and one for the sound in OBX. Both have been great , a good size, visible from a distance. The material it's made of should last thru the roughest elements! Cov Pack
customer_reviews.author: Covaleen Pack

customer_reviews.title: Blow me up Buttercup
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. I inflated it with my with my inflator and that worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: TV Guy

customer_reviews.title: We use them at the dock to hold the boat off and they work great. They do not mark the surface of the ...
customer_reviews.text: These are solid, very heavy duty. We use them at the dock to hold the boat off and they work great. They do not mark the surface of the boat.

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold air
customer_reviews.text: It does not hold air. We need to fill it with air every few weeks...and that is not easy,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome size and super super durable fender!! I will buy more of these and throw out the cheap ones!!

customer_reviews.title: durable!
customer_reviews.text: We fill it up with water and use it as a punching bag.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy expensive aqua bags!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great!! It’s a lot cheaper then buying an aqua bag from title or Everlast!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any boat over 70’
customer_reviews.text: If you have a big boat these bumpers are the perfect protection against any dock. I use 3/4 rope from the top deck which makes it easy to pull bumpers out of the way . Looks great as well
customer_reviews.author: James Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Not your conventional use!
customer_reviews.text: My use of this flotation device is different than most. I use it in the lake to tie my floatation device so I can catch all the rays I can. It works well!
customer_reviews.author: Herbie

customer_reviews.title: SAME AS AQUA BAG.
customer_reviews.text: Just missing a shackle. Great for punching. Much cheaper. HAHAHAHHA...

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for punching. Glad to save half the money on something branded for boxing.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Product shipped fast Awesome Price! Made in the USA !

customer_reviews.title: Good size, stink
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for over a month. I can hardly stand to be around them they still smell so bad
customer_reviews.author: tyson d.

customer_reviews.title: absorbs punches and doesnt move around too much
customer_reviews.text: so far so good filled it with water and hung it up as a punching back. i got the A2 and it's the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, will work fine as my anchor buoy on my kayak.

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Works as advertised I just wish it included ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Works as advertised I just wish it included the special inflation piece to air it up. You wouldn't know that you need it until you receive it and realized you need a special inflation
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect slip bag/headhunter aqua bag replacement for WAY less $$. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: They are easy to fill and hold air
customer_reviews.text: Does what buoys do. I bought these as a bumper to our between boats when we tie off to someone. They are easy to fill and hold air fine
customer_reviews.author: Amber Pigg

customer_reviews.title: Great for crabbing and shrimping
customer_reviews.text: Lost too many crab and shrimp pots in puget sound with inferior buoys. These are awesome and a bit overkill, but highly visible and will not sink!
customer_reviews.author: PGpnw

customer_reviews.title: quality control sucks
customer_reviews.text: The buoy came with a stain on it that will not come out. If this was for a customer of mine I would have had to return it.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Initial impression is product looks great. Seems strong and rugged.
customer_reviews.author: Mao Van

customer_reviews.title: I stuffed these in the nose of my kid's kayaks ...
customer_reviews.text: I stuffed these in the nose of my kid's kayaks for extra buoyancy. In swamp tests, they do help, and they're totally durable.
customer_reviews.author: WesternerTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: They were perfect! Exactly what we needed & delivered as promised! Love the color, "saturn yellow!" Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Uppole

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Working great! Really like having these ties to my dock.

product_meta.title: Polyform A-Series Buoy
product_meta.description: The ideal buoy or fender for a variety on applications.
feature_bullets: A versatile, heavy duty buoy made by Polyform and manufactured in the U.S.A
A-1 buoys measure 11 in. diameter by 15 in. tall with 1 in. ropehold eye diameter
Commonly used as a marker buoy, anchor buoy, or mooring buoy, and provides enhanced protection when used as a boat fender
Suggested for boats approximately 20-30 ft. long, when used as a fender
This product ships deflated inflate using 1) a Polyform Inflation Adapter with any standard tire pump connection 2) a tapered nozzle blow gun or 3) a Polyform specialty hand pump
